institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Global Job Support Business Rules/Article 20 (Sanctions on Operating Agencies)
contents: Article 20 (Sanctions on operating organizations) ① The chairman may take sanctions, such as termination of agreement and restrictions on participation in the project, depending on the severity of the case, against operating organizations that have problems during the period of participation in the global job support project. Specific sanctions standards are detailed in detail. The chairman of the board determines separately for each project. Revised September 11, 2020, ② The details of specific sanctions under Paragraph 1 shall be decided through the Sanctions Committee. ③ The Sanctions Committee shall be comprised of no more than 4 to 7 members (hereinafter referred to as *sanctions committee members). The chairman of the sanctions committee shall be the director of the Overseas Employment Bureau. Revised September 11, 2020, ④ Sanction members are appointed by the Chairman of the Board from among government agencies, academia, industry, labor experts, and Corporation employees. However, those who are involved in corruption such as receiving money or entertainment, illegal lobbying, breach of trust, or embezzlement, or those who are judged to be unable to conduct fair deliberation, are excluded. ⑤ Other details regarding the operation of the sanctions committee shall be separately determined by the chairman of the board.
